name: The last astronaut
description:
3/10
What happens if an astronaut dies in space?
The first logical thought would be to keep the body inside the ship to 'repatriate' it home. But then one would think how difficult this is given the conditions a ship is subjected to. Launch it into space? The UN considers it "contamination of the cosmos."
The body is put into a GoreTex fabric bag, turning it into a kind of sarcophagus, and then a robot would shake it to disintegrate the body and leave only its dust, some remains that would be taken to Earth.
